getting-started

Node.js

npm install bluebird

Then:

var Promise = require("bluebird");

Alternatively in ES6

import * as Promise from 'bluebird';

Browsers

(See also Installation.)

There are many ways to use bluebird in browsers:

  • Direct downloads
    • Full build bluebird.js
    • Full build minified bluebird.min.js
    • Core build bluebird.core.js
    • Core build minified bluebird.core.min.js
  • You may use browserify on the main export
  • You may use the bower package.

When using script tags the global variables Promise and P (alias for Promise) become available. Bluebird runs on a wide variety of browsers including older versions. Weâ€™d like to thank BrowserStack for giving us a free account which helps us test that.
